001package net.tvburger.jdl.model.training.loss;
002
003import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Decorator;
004import net.tvburger.jdl.common.patterns.Strategy;
005
006import java.util.List;
007
008/**
009 * A decorator loss function that applies a fixed scaling factor
010 * to the results of another loss function.
011 *
012 * <p>
013 * {@code ScaledError} can operate at multiple levels of loss
014 * calculation — dimension, sample, and batch — by delegating to
015 * an underlying {@link LossFunction} and scaling its results by
016 * a constant multiplier.
017 * </p>
018 *
019 * <p>
020 * For example, when wrapping a {@link SquaredError} with a scaling
021 * factor of {@code 0.5}, this class produces the commonly used
022 * Mean Squared Error (MSE) formulation:
023 * <pre>
024 * MSE = 0.5 * (predicted - target)^2
025 * </pre>
026 */
027@Decorator
028@Strategy(Strategy.Role.CONCRETE)
029public class ScaledError implements DimensionLossFunction, SampleLossFunction, BatchLossFunction {
030
031    private final float scale;
032    private final LossFunction lossFunction;
033
034    /**
035     * Creates a new {@code ScaledError} that decorates the given
036     * {@link LossFunction} with a scaling factor.
037     *
038     * @param scale        the factor by which to scale the computed loss values
039     * @param lossFunction the underlying {@link LossFunction} to decorate
040     */
041    public ScaledError(float scale, LossFunction lossFunction) {
042        this.scale = scale;
043        this.lossFunction = lossFunction;
044    }
045
046    /**
047     * {@inheritDoc}
048     */
049    @Override
050    public float calculateBatchLoss(List<Float> sampleLosses) {
051        return ((BatchLossFunction) lossFunction).calculateBatchLoss(sampleLosses) * scale;
052    }
053
054    /**
055     * {@inheritDoc}
056     */
057    @Override
058    public float calculateGradient_dJ_dL(int batchSize) {
059        return ((BatchLossFunction) lossFunction).calculateGradient_dJ_dL(batchSize) * scale;
060    }
061
062    /**
063     * {@inheritDoc}
064     */
065    @Override
066    public float calculateDimensionLoss(float estimated, float target) {
067        return ((DimensionLossFunction) lossFunction).calculateDimensionLoss(estimated, target) * scale;
068    }
069
070    /**
071     * {@inheritDoc}
072     */
073    @Override
074    public float calculateGradient_dl_da(float estimated, float target) {
075        return ((DimensionLossFunction) lossFunction).calculateGradient_dl_da(estimated, target) * scale;
076    }
077
078    /**
079     * {@inheritDoc}
080     */
081    @Override
082    public float calculateSampleLoss(List<Float> dimensionLosses) {
083        return ((SampleLossFunction) lossFunction).calculateSampleLoss(dimensionLosses) * scale;
084    }
085
086    /**
087     * {@inheritDoc}
088     */
089    @Override
090    public float calculateGradient_dL_dl(int dimensions) {
091        return ((SampleLossFunction) lossFunction).calculateGradient_dL_dl(dimensions) * scale;
092    }
093}
